author: Jeffrey M
title: We loved V&G
text:
We spent 4 nights in Paris with our grown children and loved it. We would certainly return to Victoire & Germain. It is modernly decorated, very clean and comfortable with beautiful bathrooms and nice French products. I was told that the hotel was renovated only six months ago and the modern look was a bit risky for them. The staff could not have been nicer, though only one, Jason, was sufficiently knowledgeable to be considered a concierge. The hotel has a total of 8 floors. There are 6 floors of rooms, with 3 rooms per floor. The main floor has a small reception area and a lobby that is large enough for about four people. The lower level has a nice dining room with breakfast served but we did not use it.
The hotel is on a very small sidestreet off a major boulevard, St Germaine, and a mere block and a half from the Odeon metro stop. It's a great neighborhood to stay in. Further from St Germaine down more tiny streets are a variety of fabulous pastries, cafes, bistros and shopping. It was within walking distance of most of what we wanted to see, or an easy metro or taxi ride. We loved walking the city, it is so beautiful.
There are two improvements that I hope the hotel makes. The first is giving the staff training to be expert concierges. The second is to replace the in-room desks with dressers so there are drawers to unpack into. We lived out of our suitcases.other than hanging.
